2) Education

I have done most of my studies at the Technical University of Compiegne (2010-2015), a French top ranking engineering institution. I have obtained my degree from the urban engineering department, but I have equaly shared my time with the electrical department. Here is my transcript.

The most influent lecture I had during my studies were « Renewable energy conversion and management » « Power electronics » « Electrical machines » and « Urban management ». The design of a small scale wind turbine controller has been one of my biggest academic project (short report).

Through my work at the UTC I obtained recommandation letters from: Fabrice Locment and Manuela Sechilariu, Phillipe Sergent and Vincent Lanfranchi.

I have also spent a semester of study abroad in Riga (Latvia). Here is a transcript of my semester.

3) Work experiences

Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory from 2015 to nowadays, my work is focused on vehicle to grid interactions, and grid reliability.

CEREMA (Centre For Studies and Expertise on Risks, Environment, Mobility, and Urban and Country planning). I studied the best emplacement to harvest wave’s energy at the shore in Audierne’s bay. The project involved the use of SWASH to provide a general basis for describing wave transformations from deep water to a beach, port or harbour. The study (final report in French) also includes a cost analysis for different devices.
